body:
ü§ñ Bug in `testing/simulator/src/basic_sim.rs:178`: The second line overwrites the division result and uses `seconds_per_slot` (seconds) instead of `slot_duration_ms` (milliseconds):

```rust
spec.slot_duration_ms /= speed_up_factor;
spec.slot_duration_ms = max(1_000, spec.seconds_per_slot);  // ‚ùå Wrong variable
```

Should be:
```rust
spec.slot_duration_ms /= speed_up_factor;
spec.slot_duration_ms = max(1_000, spec.slot_duration_ms);
```

Note that `fallback_sim.rs:184-185` has the correct implementation.

---

ü§ñ In `consensus/types/src/chain_spec.rs` (`get_slot_component_duration` method): Should we avoid `.expect()` here? This gets called in hot paths for every attestation/sync committee timing check. While overflow is unlikely with valid basis points, could we either return `Result<Duration, ArithError>` or add a comment explaining why the panic is safe? (e.g., the max intermediate value with mainnet parameters is far from u64::MAX)

---

ü§ñ In `beacon_node/network/src/network_beacon_processor/sync_methods.rs:306`: Stale comment reference mentions `slot_clock.single_lookup_delay()` which was removed in this PR. Should update or remove this reference.

---

ü§ñ General question: Are there plans to deprecate `seconds_per_slot`? Both fields now exist in `ChainSpec`. Should `seconds_per_slot` be marked deprecated or documented as maintained only for config backward compatibility?

Hey @eserilev 

I've reviewed the PR, please see my comments - there are a few issues but most of the changes look safe and I think we're close to merging this! 

Let me know if you'd like to discuss on any of the comments or if they're unclear.
